title: (x) American Newspaper Headline - Times Modern by Neville Brody {Nick Cooke}
content:
Hey,  
i just found this snippet of a newspaper and fall in love with the headline type. think that it is out of an american newspaper.

thanks for help!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [bush.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011042441/http:/typophile.com/files/bush.jpg) | 270.11 KB |

 [‹ (x) Classic postcard chunky font - hand lettered {Patricia}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011042441/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36133 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "Simply beautiful" script - Zapfino {Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011042441/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36137 "Go to next forum topic")
author: sub

comments.content:
Not American - I think it’s from a British newspaper.

It looks like the horribly spiky new font for The Times, done by Neville Brody’s Research Studios.

Nick Cooke

Are you sure about Fedra Serif? I might be wrong here, but it doesn’t look like it to me. I was just reading The Times a couple of days ago and if memory serves I think Nick is right. Wish I hadn’t tossed my copy.
ah, yes its the Times Modern by Neville Brody for the redesign of The Times. Super Thanks.

“Are you sure about Fedra Serif? I might be wrong here, but it doesn’t look like it to me.”

Agreed. :(

To be honest, just a stab in the dark. See the similarities though?
Except Fedra Serif is a fine face and Times Modern… well… [isn’t](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011042441/http:/www.typographer.org/). :^P
